name: Chicken Suiza Cornbread Bake
author: THEO72
summary: A lightly spiced, Mexican-inspired casserole with a cornbread bottom, and a filling of chicken, mushroom and sour cream.
ingredients: 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
2 ⅓ cups chopped cooked chicken breast
2 tablespoons canned green chile peppers, chopped
¼ teaspoon salt, or to taste
¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package Monterey Jack cheese, shredded
directions: Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C)
Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat
Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until tender, 4 to 6 minutes (see Cook's Note)
Remove from heat and set aside
In a large bowl, combine corn, cream-style corn, salt, and egg substitute
In a large bowl, combine chicken, green chiles, mushrooms, sour cream, salt and pepper
Spoon over corn mixture to within 1 inch from edge
Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until edges are golden brown
